data_table.description: All Discovered Death Outcome Detail (Form 124/120) (Main, Ext1, Ext2)

variable.name: DEATHALL
variable.comment: Any report of death, regardless of consent status. This variable, unlike the DEATH variable, does not censor deaths that occur after the participants's last consent period. Death was adjudicated for CT and OS participants through Ext1. In Ext2, death is only adjudicated for the Medical Record Cohort (MRC). Non MRC cause of death is determined by the initial cause of death form (form 120). See the DEATHALLSRC variable for details about the death adjudication process.

variable.name: DEATHALLDY
variable.description: Days enrollment to All Discovered Death
variable.comment: Days enrollment to All Discovered Death

variable.name: DEATHALLSRC
variable.comment: During the core WHI study, central adjudications of Death were only done in the CT. In Ext1 deaths were centrally adjudicated for all participants. In Ext2, death is only adjudicated for the Medical Record Cohort (MRC). Non MRC cause of death is determined by the initial cause of death form (form 120).

variable.name: DEATHALLCAUSE
variable.comment:
'Unknown cause (not yet adj)' (code 100) are reported deaths that have not been adjudicated either because the adjudication is in process or WHI was unable to get sufficient documentation to perform an adjudication. In Ext2 only MRC deaths are adjudicated. Non MRC cause of death is determined by the initial cause of death form (form 120). The cause of death values from the form 120 are a subset of the causes of death that can be determined from a form 124. _x000D_
_x000D_
If the form 124 was marked Other or Unknown cause of death the ICD code was used to determine cause of death (see the UNDRICD variable). A cross tabulation of DEATHCAUSE with UNDRICD should be examined to ascertain which ICD codes are included in each DEATHCAUSE category.

variable.name: DEATHALLCAUSESRC
variable.description: Cause of All Discovered Death ascertainment source
variable.comment: Cause of death is usually determined from the form 124 underlying cause of death subclass question. If this question is answered other/unknown and has an ICD code, the cause of death will be determined from the ICD code. In the case of an Ext2 non MRC death, the cause of death comes from the form 120 subclass question.

variable.name: ENDFOLLOWALLDY
variable.description: Days enrollment to end of followup (including All Discovered Death)
variable.comment: Days enrollment to either the participant's uncensored death date (DEATHALLDY), the last NDI search date for the ppt or ENDFOLLOWDY ENDFOLLOWALLDY should only be used for analyses utilizing All Discovered Death (DEATHALL) during WHI, Ext1 and Ext2.

variable.name: ENDEXT1ALLDY
variable.description: Days enrollment to the end of Ext1 followup (including All Discovered Death)
variable.comment: Days enrollment to either the participant's uncensored death date (DEATHALLDY), the last NDI search date for the ppt or ENDFOLLOWDY censored at the end of Ext1. ENDEXT1ALLDY should only be used for analyses utilizing All Discovered Death (DEATHALL) during WHI and Ext1.

variable.name: UNDRICD
variable.comment: ICD CM code relating to underlying cause of death. These codes come directly from Form 124 - Report of Death. Early versions of form 124 recorded only ICD-9-CM codes, later versions could record ICD-9-CM or ICD-10-CM codes. The CCC reviewed some of the cases where the cause of death was "unknown" or "other" (values 8, 9, 88 or 99). In cases where a cause of death could be determined, this field has been updated with the corresponding ICD-10-CM code. Note: ICD-10-CM codes include a letter in the first position; ICD-9-CM codes do not. www.icd9data.com provides a handy reference for both version 9 and 10 ICD codes.

variable.name: DTHAUTOPSY
variable.comment: Was an autopsy performed? Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHMEDRECS
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: Medical records documentation Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHAUTOPSYREP
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: Report of autopsy findings Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHCERT
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: Death certificate Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHERREC
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: ER record Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHEMSREP
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: EMS report Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHINFINT
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: Informant interview Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHF120
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: Form 120 - Initial Notification of Death Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHNDISRCH
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: National Death Index search Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHCORREP
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: Coroner's report Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHOTHERDOC
variable.comment: Documentation used for death adjudication: Other Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHMI
variable.comment: Coronary death based on: Hospitalized myocardial infarction within 28 days of death Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHPREVANGINA
variable.description: F124 Coronary Death prev Angina, MI or Revasc
variable.comment:
Coronary death based on: Previous angina, myocardial infarction, or revascularization procedure and no known potentially lethal_x000D_
non-coronary disease process Not on early versions of form 124. Revascularizations added after WHI closeout.

variable.name: DTHCHD
variable.comment: Coronary death based on: Coronary heart disease (CHD) diagnosed as cause of death at post-mortem examination Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHCABGPTCA
variable.comment: Coronary death based on: Death resulting from a CHD-related procedure, such as coronary bypass grafting (CABG) or percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA) Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHOTHER
variable.comment: Coronary death based on: Other (none of the above) Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHCORSUBCLASS
variable.comment: Coronary death subclassification: Not on early versions of form 124.

variable.name: DTHCORTIMING
variable.comment: Not on early versions of form 124
